array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC100
array.item: Whole Garam Masala - 1 cinnamon, 3 cloves, 3 cardamom|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC100
array.item: Wash and cut chicken (or turkey) in small size pieces.
Take a deep bowl mix chilly powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, garam masala, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice and make a paste.
Add chicken (or turkey) pieces to this and rub to coat the masala to all sides of chicken. Let this marinate for at least half an hour in the refrigerator.
Now heat oil in a kadai or deep sauce pan and fry the ingredients under \'To Grind\' on medium flame for about 1 minute or until it turns brown and gives out a nice aroma.
After it cools grind it into a fine paste with little water. (If you are in a hurry, You can grind these without frying.)
Now take the same kadai, heat some oil, add cumin seeds and curry leaves and let it splutter.
Add onions and fry for few minutes till it browns.
Next add the ginger-garlic paste and saute until the raw smell vanishes.
Now add the tomato paste and saute until everything becomes a paste.
Add the coconut paste, required salt and chicken masala.
Now add the marinated chicken and fry it for 2 minutes[ALARM(2)].
Cover and cook for 15 minutes[ALARM(15)] until the chicken is thoroughly cooked. Simmer for few minutes till oil floats on top.
Garnish with coriander leaves and split chillies.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC101
array.item: Tamarind juice - made from 2-3 tamarind (lemon sized tamarind ball or 1 tblsp of tamarind pulp)|tamarind
Other veggies that can be added - Brinjal pieces, drumstick, banana peppers or raw mangoes

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC101
array.item: Heat oil in a small pan and roast the grated coconut with the onions, garlic, ginger and dry red chillies till the coconut turns nice and brown. Set aside to cool.

Similarly roast the coriander seeds, black peppercorns, curry leaves, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds and carom seeds too. ( Roasting each ingredient separately is better but if you do not have time, you can roast everything together.)
Once everything cools grind everything together (all the spices under ingredients -2) to a fine paste and keep aside.
Heat little oil in a clay pot/deep pan. If you are adding any veggies, saute the veggies and tomato pieces till it is partly mashed up.
Add the ground spice masala, asafoetida and tamarind juice. Add required water and bring it to a boil.
Check for salt and add the fish pieces. Cover and cook it for 5-10 minutes.[ALARM(5)]
Reduce the flame to the lowest and let the gravy simmer for another 15-20 minutes[ALARM(15)] till the oil separates from the gravy.
Heat little coconut/sesame oil in a pan and splutter the mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add this to the gravy.
Garnish with finely chopped cilantro and split green chillies. The final curry should have equal amount of spiciness from the masala, tanginess from the tamarind and salt.
Let the gravy rest for 2 hours before serving for the spices to enter the fish pieces nicely. Serve with hot plain white rice.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC102
array.item: Hard boil 5 eggs. After it is cool enough to handle, crack and remove the shell, cut it into halves and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds, cumin seeds and curry leaves.
Fry the onions and ginger garlic paste until golden brown.
Add the tomatoes and cook till it becomes soft.
Add chilly powder, turmeric powder, corriander powder, garam masala and fry till everything blends and forms a nice paste.
Add water as needed, cover and let the gravy come to a boil.
Add the hard boiled eggs to the gravy and let it simmer for 2 minutes[ALARM(2)].
Break a raw egg into the gravy. Mix everything together, cover and let it simmer until the gravy becomes thick and the egg is cooked. This induces the egg flavour throughout the gravy.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with rice or roti.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC103
array.item: Fresh Cream ( or Heavy cream) - 1/4 cup

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC103
array.item: Wash the turkey/chicken and cut it into 1 inch thick cubes.
Apply little salt, chillipowder, corriander powder, kasoori methi and ginger garlic paste. Shallow fry in little oil and keep it aside. You can also put it in skewers and bake it in the oven.
Heat some oil/butter in a pan and saute the onions followed by ginger garlic paste, green chilly and tomatoes.
When all these are nicely sauteed, remove from stove and let it cool a bit.
After it is cool enough to handle, grind everything in a blender/ mixie with the cashew nuts to make a paste.
Melt the butter in a pan, splutter some cumin seeds. Add this groud mixture and cook it for few minutes until the nuts gets cooked.
Next add the fried turkey/chicken pieces, with all the dry spices like chilly powder, corriander powder, turmeric powder, kasoori methi, garam masala and salt.
Cover and let it cook for 10-15 minutes[ALARM(10)] in medium low flame so the flavours combine nicely.
Add the heavy cream, mix everything and let it simmer for few minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro or some cream and serve with pulav, naan, roti. It goes well with anything.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC104
array.item: Take a skillet and heat some oil in it. Now fry all the ingredients from batch-1.
Once the aroma starts coming, remove it from fire and let it cool. After it cools, grind everything together with some water to form a very fine paste and keep aside.
Now take a clay pot or deep vessel, heat some oil, splutter mustard, fenugreek seeds and curry leaves.
Now add the tamarind juice,chilly powder, corriander powder, turmeric powder, tomatoes, salt, asafoetida powder along with the ground masala and bring it to a boil.
Add the fish fillets, cover and cook for 10 minutes[ALARM(10)] on low-medium flame. The fish fillets are cooked when they become opaque and soft.
Garnish with fresh curry leaves, cilantro and split green chilly and serve hot.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC105
array.item: Chicken Breast - 1 lbs (cut into desired pieces)|chicken
Ginger Garlic Green Chilly paste - 1 tblsp|gingergarlic

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC105
array.item: 1.Mix all the ingredients from batch -1 and let it rest for 1/2 hour.
Wash the spinach and Microwave Batch -2 in little water for 2-3 minutes[ALARM(2)] and allow it to cool.
Heat oil/butter in a deep vessel and saute onions until golden grown.
Add the tomatoes and saute until it comes as a gravy.
Now add the Batch-1 marinated chicken into the pan and little water.
Let it boil until chicken is cooked.
Now grind the cooked spinach in the blender by adding little water to get a paste.
Add the spinach paste and nutmeg powder into the chicken pan.
Let it cook fo 5 more minutes.[ALARM(5)]
Now garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
1Serve it with hot chapathi,parrota or any fried rice.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC106
array.item: Soak kuskus in 1 cup warm water for 10 minutes[ALARM(10)] and then grind it with green chillies, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cashews,cardamom and coconut. Keep it aside.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Splutter fennel seeds.Add the bay leaf, cloves and cinnamon.
Add sliced onions and fry them till they are translucent. Next add the ginger-garlic paste and saute till the raw smell vanishes.
Add the chicken/turkey pieces and saute for 2 minutes.[ALARM(2)] Next add 1 cup water, yogurt and salt to it. Cover and cook till the chicken is almost done.
At this stage add the ground paste and add the water required. Check for salt and let the kurma simmer for 5 minutes.[ALARM(5)]

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC107
array.item: Fry the chicken in oil and keep aside.
Heat little oil in another pan, add the whole garam masala, onions and fry well. Next add the tomotoes.
Now add everything except chicken and kaju(cashew) paste. Cook it nicely and let it start leaving oil.
Then add little water, chicken and kaju paste. cook well.
Garnish with cream and fresh coriander leaves.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC108
array.item: Cayenne pepper/ Red Chilly Powder - 1/2 tsp|pepper

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC108
array.item: Make chicken tikkas as per the recipe.
Heat a non stick pan with oil. Add ginger garlic paste and fry for 1 min in low flame.(monitor its not burnt)
Add the tomato puree and cook until it thickens to form a paste.
Now add garam masala, cayenne pepper, corriander powder and kasuri methi.
After 1 min add the heavy cream and stir in low flame to get a thick paste. Also add leftover marination masala(optional).
Now add the tikkas and cook for 2 mins[ALARM(2)] and switch off.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC109
array.item: Whole Garam Masala - (Cloves, Cardamom - 2 pieces each, Cinnamon, Bay Leaf - 1 piece each)|cinnamoncloves
Crushed black peppercorns - 1.5 tbsp (preferably freshly crushed)|pepper

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC109
array.item: Marinate the chicken with the lemon juice, salt and turmeric powder.
Heat oil in a deep vessel. Add the mustard seeds and fennel seeds for tempering. After it splutters add whole garam masala.
Add chopped onions and green chilies. Saute until golden brown.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and curry leaves. Saute everything for 5 mins.[ALARM(5)]
Add tomatoes and saute it until it becomes pulpy.
Add chilli powder,coriander powder,cumin powder. Saute everything for 10 mins[ALARM(10)] in medium heat. When oil comes out it is the correct consistency
Now add chicken and little water. Cover and cook.
After the chicken is cooked, add the crushed pepper powder and check for seasoning.
To garnish add chopped coriander leaves and some more fresh curry leaves.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC110
array.item: Heat oil in a deep sauce pan and splutter mustard seeds, cumin seeds and curry leaves. Saute the chopped onions and crushed ginger garlic, till they turn golden brown.
Now add chopped tomatoes along with turmeric powder, chilly powder, corrainder powder, pepper powder, cumin powder, garam masala and salt. Let this mixture cook till we get a nice masala.
Add shrimp and mix well to coat the masala. Add water as needed and let it simmer for few minutes.
Switch off the stove once the shrimp takes a round shape and looks firm. Do not overcook as this might make the shrimp rubbery. Garnish with corrainder leaves.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC111
array.item: Veggies - 1 cup. Any veggies like Spring Onion, bell peppers etc can be used.
Corn Starch - 2 tblsp (to thicken the sauce)
Honey - (to add some sweetness to the sauce)

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC111
array.item: Marinate the chicken with some soy sauce (2 tblsp) and salt for atleast 15 minutes.[ALARM(15)]
Heat the oil in a wok and stir fry the chicken until the chicken is cooked. (The chicken is traditionally deep fried.)
Remove the chicken and keep it aside.
Heat some oil in the same wok and stir fry the ginger and veggies for just a minute or two.
Add the sauce ingredients - vineger, soy sauce, chilly garlic sauce and water/chicken broth.
(You can add some corn starch and honey to the sauce depending on how thick and how sweet you want your sauce to be. I havent added either, to suit to my taste.)
Bring the sauce to a boil and add the fried chicken pieces. (Check for salt and other seasonings at this stage. Add some chilly powder if you need more heat.)
Transfer the chicken with the sauce to the serving tray and top it with the sesame seeds. Serve with fried rice/ noodles.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC112
array.item: (You can also add all almonds too)
Whole Garam Masala - ( 1 piece cinnamon, 4 cloves, 2 cardomon)|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC112
array.item: Soak the almonds, cashews and green chillies for 5-10 minutes[ALARM(5)] and make a paste of it along with the soaked water. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add the garam masala and fennel seeds.
Fry the chopped onions till it sweats. Next fry the ginger garlic paste.
Next add the corriander-cumin powder and 1/4 cup of water to prevent the masala from getting burnt.
Cover and cook this paste for 15 minutes[ALARM(15)] till oil seperates from the masala.
Now add the yogurt and chicken pieces and saute for 5 minutes.[ALARM(5)]
Add the coconut milk/cream, required salt, white pepper powder and more water as needed. Cover and let the chicken cook till it is completely cooked.
Garnish with finely chopped cilantro and sliced almonds and serve with pulav or roti varieties.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC113
array.item: Coconut Milk - 2 cups (Tastes best with fresh coconut milk)|shreddedcoconut

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC113
array.item: Wash the fish fillets thoroughly and then marinate with turmeric powder, chilly powder and salt. Keep it aside.
Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the fish fillets.
After a few minutes, or when fillets turn light golden brown in color, remove the pieces.
In the same oil, fry onions, curry leaves, garlic and ginger till they get cooked.
Add sliced green chilies and fry for a minute.
Add water, lemon juice, pepper powder and salt to the above.
Boil the mixture and then lower the flame.
Add coconut milk and simmer the gravy for 3 to 4 minutes[ALARM(3)] until it becomes thick. Do not let it come to a full boil. Just let it simmer.
Now add the fried fish fillets to the above and cook for another 2-3 minutes.[ALARM(2)]

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC114
array.item: Corriander leaves & Mint leaves paste - 3 tblsp

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC114
array.item: Marinate the mutton with 1 tblsp. oil, yoghurt, white salt, 1 tblsp. garam masala powder, coriander/pudina paste, ginger/garlic paste, for atleast 2 hours. If overnight, cover with plastic foil & refrigerate.
Heat 6 tblsp oil. Add bay leaves (tejpatta) & chopped onion and fry well until onion turns pink.
Add mutton, fry it well. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, tomato puree and fry well until oil separates.
Now let mutton cook either using pressure cooker or in a vessel.
As the mutton is nearing to cook add the potatoes and let them cook along with mutton.
After mutton is cooked add brown onion paste, cashew (kaju) paste, 1 tblsp. garam masala powder and black salt.
Garnish with finely chopped green coriander. Serve with pav/naan/roti.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC115
array.item: Assorted Whole Garam Masala - (1 cinnamon, 1 bay leaf, 3 cloves etc)|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC115
array.item: Marinate the chicken with the yogurt and all the dry masala powders (chilly powder, garam masala, turmeric powder and pepper powder).
Heat oil in a pan and fry the whole garam masala and cumin seeds.
Add the onions and cook till it turns nice and golden brown.
Add the ginger garlic paste and fry for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook till the oil separates. (Note: Tomatoes are not traditionally added in this recipe. It can be added or not depending on individual taste.)
Add the marinated chicken to this and bring everything to a boil. Add water if you want a thinner gravy.
Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes[ALARM(10)] stirring occasionally.
Mix in the finely chopped coriander leaves.
Finally garnish with fresh curry leaves and split green chillies. Curd chicken curry is ready to be served.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC116
array.item: Dry red Chillies - 5-8 (or use chilly powder as needed)|drychillies

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC116
array.item: You can use store bought fried onions for this recipe. If not, slice the onions and deep fry
in oil till it turns crispy and brown in colour.
Grind together all the ingredients under \'to grind\' adding water as needed to make a very
Mix this paste with the chicken and let it marinate for atleast half an hour.
Heat oil in a pan and add the marinated chicken along with the masala (marinade).
Add the coconut milk, potatoes and required salt to this. Add more water if you want more gravy.
Cover and cook till the chicken is done and oil seperates from the gravy.
The fried onions and the red chillies give a bright red colour to the gravy. So it does not
need any garnishing. Serve with rice.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC117
array.item: Heavy Cream - 1/4 cup (You could also use thick coconut milk instead)|shreddedcoconut

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC117
array.item: Marinate the chicken pieces with salt, pepper powder and lemon juice for at least half an hour before preparing the curry.
Make a smooth paste of all the ingredients under \'to grind\'. Try to avoid water while grinding or add as little as possible.
Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan and add the bay leaf and fennel seeds.
Add the finely chopped onions and fry till it is golden brown.
Add the ground paste and let it cook until the oil separates from the masala. This will take about 10 minutes.[ALARM(10)]
Add the yogurt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and garam masala. Fry for about half a minute before adding the chicken.
After adding the chicken, saute it with the masala for at least 3 minutes.[ALARM(3)]
Add required water, salt and bring it to a boil. Cover the pan and cook till the chicken is no more raw and oil starts separating from the gravy.
Add the heavy cream to the curry and mix well. Switch off. The green chicken curry is ready to be served

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC118
array.item: Tomato - 1 (chopped or mashed up with hands)|tomato

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC118
array.item: In a pressure cooker add the bony chicken pieces, onion, green chilly and tomato.
Add about 5-6 cups of water, salt and turmeric powder.
Pressure cook for 7-8 whistles. We want the bones to break down and release all its essence.
In the meantime, coarsely grind the ingredients under \'For Tempering\' using the pulse mode. You can also use a motar and pestle to crush the ingredients.
Heat oil in a small pan, add the coarsely ground masala and fry for a minute.
After the pressure goes down, open the cooker and turn on the heat.
Add the tempering, chicken masala and chopped cilantro to the rasam.
Bring it to a boil and switch off. Serve it piping hot.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC119
array.item: (You can also add other seafood like squid, scallops etc.)

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC119
array.item: Grind the tomatoes, coconut and fennel powder to a fine paste. Keep this aside.
Soak the tamarind in about 2 cups of water for about 10 minutes[ALARM(10)] and extract its pulp.
Mix the chilly powder, corriander powder and turmeric powder with this pulp and keep it aside.
Heat oil in a wide pan or clay pot. Saute the onions and green chillies till they turn golden brown.
Add the spiced up tamarind pulp to this and bring it to a boil.
Add the fish and shrimp pieces to the gravy.
Add the ground coconut-tomato paste and required salt to the gravy.
Bring it to a boil, reduce the flame and let it simmer till the oil seperates from the gravy.
Heat 1 tblsp of oil in another pan and fry the fenugreek seeds.
Add this tempering to the gravy and switch off.
1Garnish with cilantro and serve with white rice.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC120
array.item: Take a heavy bottomed pan, heat the oil and splutter the cumin and fennel seeds.
Add the chopped onions and saute till it turns golden brown.
Add the ginger garlic paste and green chillies. Fry for a minute till the raw smell vanishes.
Add the chicken pieces, beaten yogurt and salt. Stir fry for few minutes.
Add all the dry spice powders (corriander, cumin, chilly, turmeric and fennel powders).
Add the tomato puree and required water. If you want a dry dish add very little water.
Cover and cook for about 15 minutes[ALARM(15)] till the oil seperates from the masala.
Finally add the methi leaves and garam masala powder.
Cook for a minute and switch off.
Serve hot with roti, pulao, idli or white rice.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC121
array.item: First of all, grind all the ingredients under \'List I\' and keep it aside.
Similarly, grind the ingredients under \'List II\' and set aside.
You can make this kurma in two ways - (i) Hard Boil the eggs and add it to the gravy.
(ii) Break a raw egg into the gravy and cook it.
The recipe is the same for both the kurmas.
Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan/kadai and add the ground paste of \'List I\'.
Saute for 2 minutes[ALARM(2)] on medium high flame and then add the dry spice powders.
Next add the ground paste of \'List II\', about 2 cups of water and required salt.
Boil this for about 7-8 minutes [ALARM(7)]till everything is cooked and oil separates.
Add the egg at this stage and simmer for 4-5 minutes.[ALARM(4)]
- If you are adding hard boiled eggs, make few slits for the gravy to be absorbed.
- If using raw egg, break open the egg and gently add to the simmering gravy for the egg to get poached.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC122
array.item: List II (To dry roast and powder)
Dry red chillies - 10 Coriander Seeds - 3 tbsp|drychillies
Whole Garam Masala - 2" piece cinnamon stick, 3 cloves, 3 cardamom, 1 star anise, 3 kalpasi|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC122
array.item: Cut the chicken and cut it into medium size pieces. Marinate it with salt, lemon juice and turmeric powder for at least half an hour.
Dry roast the ingredients under \'List II\' on low flame till the coconut turns golden brown in colour. After it cools make a powder of it and keep aside.
Make a paste of the ingredients under \'List I\'. Keep this aside.
Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan and add the cumin seeds and bay leaf.
Add the chopped onions and fry till it becomes brown in colour.
Add the ground paste of \'List I\' and fry till the raw smell is gone.
Add the marinated chicken and fry for few minutes. The chicken releases lot of water.
Now add the remaining ingredients - tomato puree, powdered mixture of \'List II\', required salt and water.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes.[ALARM(15)] By now the chicken pieces will be completely cooked.
This is the right time to check for salt and other spices. Adjust anything if needed.
Cook uncovered till the oil floats on top of the gravy.
Add the finely chopped cilantro and fresh curry leaves and switch off. Keep the gravy covered till you are ready to serve.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC123
array.item: Whole Garam Masala - 1 bay leaf, 2" piece cinnamon stick, 2 cloves, 3 cardamoms|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC123
array.item: Clean the crab and cut it. Add some salt and keep it aside.
Heat oil in a deep pan (kadai) and temper the whole garam masala, cumin seeds, fennel seeds and curry leaves.
Add the onions and green chillies and fry till it turns golden.
Next fry the ginger garlic paste for a minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook till the tomatoes are mashed up.
Now add the chilly powder, coriander powder and turmeric powder.
Now add the crabs and mix to coat the crabs with the masala.
Add some water depending on how much gravy you need. You can also make it a semi gravy dish.
Cover and let it cook for 5-7 minutes.[ALARM(5)] The crab turns red in color when done. If you overcook the crab it will become stringy.
In the meantime grind the ingredients under \'To grind\'.
Add this ground paste to the crab gravy. Check for salt and other seasonings and adjust if needed.
Let the gravy simmer for another 5 minutes[ALARM(5)] for the ground masala to get cooked.
Finally add chopped cilantro and switch off.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC124
array.item: Soak the dried fish in some water for about 10 minutes.[ALARM(10)]
Drain the water and wash it thoroughly to remove any grits.
Heat oil in a pan and splutter the mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds and curry leaves.
Add the onions and green chillies and fry it golden brown.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook till the tomatoes become mushy.
Add the salt, turmeric powder, chilly powder and corriander powder. Also add the chopped vegetables.
Add the tamarind pulp and required water. Bring it to a boil.
Cover and let it cook till the vegetables are almost cooked.
Make a smooth paste of the coconut and add it to the gravy.
Finally add the dried fish. Cover again and cook till the oil seperates from the gravy.
Switch off and let the gravy rest for atleast 1 hour before serving.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC125
array.item: Fennel Powder (or crushed fennel seeds) - 1/2 tsp|fennelseeds
Cumin Powder (or crushed cumin seeds) - 1/2 tsp|cuminseeds
Coconut milk - 1/2 cup (you can also use beaten yogurt instead)|shreddedcoconut

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC125
array.item: Take the kheema in a big bowl and add ginger garlic paste, red chilly powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt and finely chopped cilatro.
Mix well and make lime sized balls with it. Wet your hands while making the balls to prevent the ground meat from sticking.
Arrange the koftas in a plate and let it rest while we prepare the gravy.
To make the gravy, heat 1 tblsp oil in a wide pan and saute the onions till they are golden brown.
Remove from the stove, cool a little and make a fine paste of the onions along with the cashew nuts. (You can skip step 4 by using store bought fried onions).
Heat another 1 tblsp of oil in the same pan and add the ground onions-cashew paste to it.
Add the ginger garlic paste and green chillies and saute together for a minute or so.
Next add the pureed tomatoes, cover and cook till the tomatoes are nicely cooked.
Add the turmeric powder, red chilly powder, fennel powder, cumin powder and corriander powder.
Add the coconut milk and required water. Add salt and bring the gravy to a boil.
(You can also use beaten yogurt instead of coconut milk as a healthy alternative. Coconut milk and yogurt gives two different taste to the gravy but both are equally delicious.)
1Reduce the flame and gently add the koftas to the gravy one at a time. Do not mix once you have added the koftas.
1Cover and cook on medium low heat for 25-30 minutes[ALARM(25)] till the koftas are well cooked.
1By now the koftas and oil will be floating on top of the gravy. Add the garam masala powder and chopped cilantro and simmer for another 5 minutes.
1Switch off and serve with white rice, any roti varieties or any pulav varieties.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC126
array.item: Heat the oil in a clay pot or a pan, splutter the mustard seeds, fennel seeds and peppercons.
Add the curry leaves followed by the sliced shallots, ginger, garlic and green chillies. Saute for few minutes.
Mix the chilly powder, turmeric powder and corriander powder in a separate bowl with some water to make a paste.
Add this masala paste along with the shallots. The water will prevent the spices from getting burnt.
Next, add the chopped tomatoes, salt and about 1 cup of water. Bring it to a boil.
Gently slide in the fish slices. Let it cook till oil seperates from the gravy.
Finally add the coconut milk. Remove from heat as soon as the coconut milk is heated through (before it boils).

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC127
array.item: Clean the crab, cut it into small pieces and keep aside.
Take a skillet and heat some oil in it. Now fry all the ingredients from batch-1.
Once the aroma starts coming, remove it from fire and let it cool. After it cools, grind everything together with some water to form a very fine paste and keep aside.
Now take a clay pot or deep vessel, heat some oil, splutter mustard, fenugreek seeds and curry leaves.
Now add the tamarind juice, chilly powder, corriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, asafoetida along with the ground masala and bring it to a boil. Add water if you want more gravy.
Add the crab pieces, cover and cook for 10 minutes[ALARM(10)] on low-medium flame. The crab is done when it turns red in colour.
Garnish with fresh curry leaves, cilantro and split green chilly and serve hot.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC128
array.item: Whole Garam Masala - 1 stick cinnamon, 3 cardomom, 3 cloves, 1 star anise|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC128
array.item: Make a paste of the ginger, garlic, green chillies and fennel seeds.
Marinate the chicken with the above paste, yogurt, pepper powder and salt.
Heat the butter/ ghee in a pan and add the whole garam masala to it.
Add chopped onions and fry till it turns golden brown.
Next add the marinated chicken and fry for a few minutes.
Cover and let the chicken cook in its own juices.
In the meantime, boil the milk in a seperate saucepan and add the saffron strands to it.
Add this saffron flavoured milk to the cooked chicken and let it boil.
Check for seasoning and add more salt and pepper powder if needed .
Reduce the flame and let the gravy simmer for 15-20 minutes.[ALARM(15)]

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC129
array.item: Heat oil in a pan or clay pot.
Add the onion paste with turmeric powder. Fry until brown.
Add the mutton pieces. Mix chilli powder and cook for 20 minutes.[ALARM(20)]
Next add the ridgegourd pieces with clove and pepper powder.
Finally mix in the coconut paste with salt. Cook for a while.
Before serving add coriander leaves. This is a tasty dish.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC130
array.item: Marinate the chicken by mixing haldi, chilli powder, coriander powder and ginger paste for half an hour.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry onion paste until brown.
After that add the marinated chicken and cook for half an hour.
Finally add tamarind paste, garam masala and salt.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC131
array.item: Whole Garam Masala - 1 cinnamon stick, 2 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 star anise, kalpasi - 2|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC131
array.item: Wash the mutton and marinate it with salt, turmeric powder and lemon juice.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a pan and add the ingredients under \'to grind\' one by one. Fry for few minutes.
Let it cool. Grind it to a smooth paste. (Note : - You may skip step 2 and add everything without frying too. Frying mellows down the flavors of the spices.)
Heat oil in a pressure cooker and fry the sliced onions.
Next add the tomatoes, bay leaf, turmeric powder and the ground masala paste.
Add the mutton pieces and potato cubes. Fry everything for few minutes.
Add water and salt as needed.
Cover the pressure cooker and cook for 6-7 whistles. (Note :- Each pressure cooker is different. Tender mutton cooks faster. Cook till you are satisfied with the tenderness of the mutton pieces.)
After the pressure is gone, open the cooker. Garnish with fresh curry leaves and cilantro.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC132
array.item: Heat oil in a clay pot. If it is prepared in clay pot, it will be tasty.
Fry the onion paste until brown.
Add the coconut paste. Cook for 5 minutes.[ALARM(5)]
Mix the tamarind paste and chilli paste in it. If you need to add water, you may add 1 cup of water.
Add the boiled eggs in it.
Finally add garam masala, coriander levaes and salt.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC133
array.item: Pickle with it oil - 2-3 tblsp (I use mango pickle or garlic pickle)|oil

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC133
array.item: Wash the chicken pieces nicely. Add some salt, lemon juice and slit green chillies to the chicken. Let this marinate while we get the other things ready.
Heat oil in a kadai and add the seasoning ingredients (paanch pooran).
Add the dry red chillies and carom seeds.
Add the chopped onion and saute till it turns golden brown.
Next fry the ginger garlic paste. Add the pureed tomato.
Add the red chilly powder, salt, turmeric powder, pickle and let it cook till oil seperates from the masala.
Add the chicken pieces and saute till the masala coats the chicken and the outside of the chicken is cooked.
Tips : - You can use any brand of pickle of your choice - home made or store bought. This is not part of the traditional recipe but adding the pickle takes the dish to a whole new level.
- If you want some gravy, add the yogurt at this stage. If you like it dry, scale down and add less curd or skip it all together.
Cover and reduce the flame. Let the chicken cook in its own juices for 15-20 minutes.[ALARM(15)] Splash some water only if the chicken sticks to the bottom of the pan.
Check for seasoning. Adjust salt, chilly powder and lemon juice according to your taste.
Garnish with cilantro and switch off. Serve with any roti or white rice.

array.name: INGREDIENT_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC134
array.item: Crushed Whole Spices - 1" cinnamon, 2 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 tsp Fennel seeds, 1/2 tsp Peppercorns (or use store bought chicken masala powder)|cinnamoncloves

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC134
array.item: Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan and crackle the mustard seeds.
Reduce the heat and add the fenugreek seeds. Fry for few seconds.
Add the ginger, garlic, curry leaves and crushed whole spices. (Reserve a pinch to add at the end.)
Cook for about half a minute.
Add the sliced onions and saute. Add some salt to speed up the process.
Saute on medium heat for 10-15 minutes[ALARM(10)] till it become golden brown and pasty.
Add the salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder and chili powder. Mix together and fry for few seconds to awaken the aroma of the spices.
Add the chicken pieces and toss to coat with the spices.
Cover and let it cook in its own juices for about 5 minutes.[ALARM(5)]
Add required amount of water. Cover and cook on medium heat for about 10 minutes.[ALARM(10)]
Add the coconut bits at this stage. Reduce the heat and cook covered for another 10 minutes[ALARM(10)] till oil separates from the gravy.
Finally add a pinch of the crushed spices and some fresh curry leaves.
Switch off and keep covered till you are ready to serve.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC135
array.item: Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan. Add the fennel seeds, garlic and ginger.
Fry for half a minute and then add the onions. Saute till it turns golden brown.
Add the tomato pieces, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder and pepper powder.
Cook for few minutes and switch off.
After it cools a bit grind it to a smooth paste with little water. Keep it ready.
In the same pan, add some oil. Add the chicken pieces and saute for 3-4 minutes.[ALARM(4)]
Add the ground masala, required salt and the thin coconut milk.
Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes[ALARM(10)] or till the chicken is completely cooked.
In the meantime, grind the soaked cashews along with the thick coconut milk.
Add this smooth paste to the gravy. Reduce the heat and let it simmer for another 5-7 minutes.[ALARM(5)] By now the gravy will get thicker and creamier. Switch off,
Transfer the curry to a serving dish.
Heat oil in a small pan for tempering. Pop the mustard seeds.
Add the sliced onions and fry till it turns golden brown.
Add the dry red chilies and curry leaves and switch off.
Add this aromatic oil on top of the curry. Keep covered with a lid until you are ready to serve.

array.name: DIRECTIONS_NVMAINCOURSE_ITC136
array.item: Take the eggs in a saucepan, add water to cover the eggs and bring to a boil. Reduce the flame and simmer for 5 minutes.[ALARM(5)] Cover and leave it for 10 minutes. Drain the hot water and add cold water to the pan. After about 5 minutes, peel the eggs to get the perfect hard boiled eggs.
Chop the onions and tomatoes finely or slice them thinly and keep it ready.
Heat oil in a pan, crackle the mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add the chopped onions and saute for 3-4 minutes.[ALARM(4)] Add the green chilies and ginger-garlic paste.
After about a minute, add the tomatoes, cover and cook for couple of minutes.
Add the salt, turmeric powder, chili powder and coriander powder. Add about 1/2 cup of water (or coconut milk) and cook till oil separates from the masala.
Make 3 or 4 slits in the eggs or cut it into halves. Add these to the curry.
Sprinkle the pepper powder and garam masala. Gently toss everything such that the masala coats all around the eggs.
Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves and serve.
